channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: ‘Tiger Zinda Hai’: How Nitish Kumar is the biggest winner in Bihar elections
Australia introduces new rule for student visas. Will it help or hurt Indian students?
Is Congress the Achilles’ heel of Mahagathbandhan in Bihar?
Nitish Kumar, women voters and more… What propelled NDA to a landslide win in Bihar
Ukraine embroiled in major energy corruption scandal. What we know
Have Republicans had enough? Is Trump facing his biggest rebellion yet over Epstein Files?
Delhi blast cautions India about internal-external terror nexus
item.description: For any nation, homegrown terrorism is amongst the most serious threats, especially if it is supported and backed by a foreign adversary

item.title: How President Murmu’s Botswana visit heralds a shared India-Africa future
item.description: As both countries prepare to celebrate 60 years of diplomatic ties in 2026, their collaboration is poised to evolve into a model of South-South partnership—one that combines India’s developmental experience and Botswana’s governance excellence

item.title: PM Modi’s Thimphu outreach: Three pillars of Indo-Bhutanese friendship amid Chinese assertiveness
item.description: India’s renewed commitment to Bhutan signals a critical recalibration of regional power dynamics and a reminder of why New Delhi’s smaller neighbour must look southward rather than northward for its security and prosperity

item.title: If unchecked, Yunus’s Bangladesh risks sliding into Islamic absolutism
item.description: A Bangladesh transformed into an Islamist fundamentalist state would unravel decades of progress toward regional integration, counterterrorism and maritime security

item.title: Faridabad module and New Delhi blast: Some answers but a lot more uncomfortable questions stare at India
item.description: The New Delhi blast and the Faridabad terror module indicate an uncomfortable time for India in terms of internal stability and regional security matrix. The Indian leadership must weigh its options.

item.title: Rich kid socialism or rising progressive force? The case of Zohran Mamdani
item.description: The future of Mamdani’s experiment depends on whether he can convert generational energy into institutional outcomes
